job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-20T00:10:33.000Z", "description": "Note: We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.

Company Overview

Lennox International (LII) is a leading global provider of innovative climate control solutions for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACR) markets.

Beginning over a century ago, Lennox International has built a strong heritage of Innovation and Responsibility. Our position as an innovation leader continually inspires us to promote more efficient energy use and a healthier environment through our product operations. Our engaged and diverse workforce is committed to providing climate control solutions that provide the most value and comfort for our customers.

We are proud to have instilled a shared sense of responsibility and commitment among our approximately 10,000 employees located throughout North America, South America, Europe, and Asia.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst, working 20 hrs per week, you will support a team of environmental professionals and work with data and systems for compliance and sustainability.

What You'll Be Doing
  • Data Management Systems (data collection and entry, system administration and reporting)
  • Document report preparation process, data sources, and required support resources
  • Research and learn requirements of U.S. and Canada \u201cProducts Containing Mercury\u201d Reporting Programs
  • Review past triennial reports to Environment Canada and (IMERC) Interstate Mercury Education & Reduction Clearinghouse
  • Engage other Departments (e.g., Product Management, IT, IAQ, etc.) as needed to obtain data required to prepare and submit mercury reports (data from 2020)
  • Complete other tasks as requested by Environmental Affairs staff
What Drives Success

Having the right qualifications is only a part of what it takes to be a successful employee. At Lennox International, we believe in following a set of behaviors and competencies to achieve your full potential. In this position, it is vital that you embody these core competencies:
  • Situational Adaptability: You flex your approach and demeanor to suit various scenarios. You successfully shift gears as new developments and competing priorities arise \u2013 balancing routine tasks, urgent action items, and long-term projects is second nature for you.
  • Decision Quality: You make thoughtful and timely decisions with the best interest of the organization in mind, prioritizing and organizing key deliverables and ensuring stakeholder buy in.
  • Drives Results : You show pride in \u201cgetting the job done\u201d with a bias for action, going above and beyond to ensure your responsibilities have been met. During high pressure moments, you work diligently to meet deadlines and show value in your work.
Qualifications

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
  • High proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.)
  • Word / PowerPoint / SharePoint
  • Good understanding of databases
  • Familiarity with process documentation
  • Familiarity with SAP a plus
  • Solid written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent collaboration and teaming skills
  • Ability to quickly learn and contribute to department initiatives
  • Ability to engage other company personnel (including virtual environment)
  • Self-driven, results oriented
  • Actively pursuing a bachelor\u2019s degree at an accredited four-year University, with min 3.0 GPA.
